meanings.definition: Covered with a hard outer layer
meanings.sent1: The old tree had the crustiest bark in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The bread from yesterday was the crustiest I had ever tasted.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's cookies were so crusty, they could break a tooth!
meanings.sent4: The crustiest rocks on the beach were like ancient armor protecting the shore.
meanings.sent5: The crustiest layer of ice on the pond cracked under our weight.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or harsh manner
meanings.sent1: The crustiest teacher in school never smiled at the students.
meanings.sent2: His crustiest comments always made people feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The crustiest customer at the cafe complained about everything on the menu.
meanings.sent4: Her crustiest tone of voice could make anyone feel small.
meanings.sent5: The crustiest boss in the office never praised anyone's work.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of age or weariness
meanings.sent1: The crustiest book on the shelf had yellowed pages and a torn cover.
meanings.sent2: The crustiest dog in the neighborhood moved slowly with a tired look.
meanings.sent3: After a long day at work, he felt like the crustiest person in the room.
meanings.sent4: The crustiest clock in the house ticked with a tired rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The crustiest chair in the living room creaked with every movement.
